CPC-specific-text.text: METALLOIDS OR COMPOUNDS THEREOF NOT COVERED BY SUBCLASS C01C

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, tradenames that are often found in scientific and patent literature have been used in order to define precisely the scope of the groups.
Attention is drawn to the definitions of groups of chemical elements following the title of section C.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
C01B35/16, C01B35/18 covered by C01B35/00
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Separation of hydrogen from mixtures containing it

reference.text: separation of gases by physical means B01D
production of water gas or synthesis gas from solid carbonaceous material C10J; purifying or modifying the chemical compositions of combustible technical gases containing carbon monoxide C10K

note.note-paragraph: In this group it is desirable to add the indexing codes of groups B01J2208/00 and B01J2219/00, for details relating to the reactors used in the generation of hydrogen or synthesis gas.

In groups C01B3/12 - C01B3/18 and in groups C01B3/22 - C01B3/586 it is desirable to add the indexing codes of group C01B2203/00, for aspects relating to hydrogen or synthesis gas generation processes.

CPC-specific-text.text: Reversible uptake of hydrogen by an appropriate medium, i.e. based on physical or chemical sorption phenomena or on reversible chemical reactions, e.g. for hydrogen storage purposes

note.note-paragraph: In all of the groups C01B3/0026 - C01B3/0084, the metallic storage materials may contain minor quantities of non-metals such as B, C, O, S, Se, Si; e.g. C01B3/0036 "only containing iron and titanium" includes Fe-Ti compositions comprising non-metals
In the groups C01B3/0026 and C01B3/0047 - C01B3/0068 a "rare-earth metal" means one single metal or a combination of metals selected from the lanthanides, Sc or Y

CPC-specific-text.text: or with carbon, i.e. nitrides; Compounds of nitrogen with more than one metal, silicon or boron

note.note-paragraph: Binary compounds, i.e. compounds of nitrogen with only one other element chosen from metals, silicon, boron or carbon, are classified in groups C01B21/06 or C01B21/0605 - C01B21/076. Compounds of nitrogen with more than one element chosen from metals, silicon or boron are classified in C01B21/0602
Documents relating to several specific binary compounds are classified in C01B21/06 only and receive the indexing codes chosen from C01B21/0602 - C01B21/076 to identify the specific compounds

the aluminium or the silicon in the network being partly replaced
containing an element or a compound occluded in the pores of the network, e.g. an oxide already present in the starting reaction mixture
After-treatment, e.g. purification or stabilisation of solutions, granulation; Dissolution; Obtaining solid silicate, e.g. from a solution by spray-drying, flashing off water or adding a coagulant

note.note-paragraph: In this group, obtaining solid silicate, e.g. as a hydrate of a crystalline silicate, from a solution or a hydrate melt by heating or cooling with or without seeding, is not considered as after-treatment, but classified in group C01B33/32

title-part.text: having base-exchange properties but not having molecular sieve properties
Layered base-exchange silicates, e.g. clays, micas or alkali metal silicates of kenyaite or magadiite type

reference.text: activation of naturally occurring clays B01J20/12; pillared layered base-exchange silicates B01J29/049
delaminated mica or vermiculite platelets obtained by a process involving cation-exchange C04B14/208

title-part.text: Products obtained from layered base-exchange silicates by ion-exchange with organic compounds such as ammonium, phosphonium or sulfonium compounds or by intercalation of organic compounds, e.g. organoclay material

reference.text: monoborane, diborane, metal borohydrides or addition complexes thereof C01B6/00; perborates C01B15/12; binary compounds with nitrogen C01B21/06;
; phosphides C01B25/08; carbides C01B32/991; alloys containing boron C22

CPC-specific-text.text: Higher boron hydrides, i.e. containing at least three boron atoms

title-part.text: Compounds containing boron and nitrogen, phosphorus, oxygen, sulfur, selenium or tellurium

CPC-specific-text.text: Carbonyl compounds derived from boron hydrides
Preparation from boron ores or borates using acids or salts
Preparation by working up other natural sources, e.g. seawater
Sodium tetraborates; Hydrates thereof, e.g. borax
Preparation from boron ores or other borates
Preparation by working up natural brines, e.g. seawater
Purification; Concentration; Dehydration; Stabilisation; Other after-treatment
of alkaline-earth metals, beryllium, aluminium or magnesium
containing plural metal or metal and ammonium

title-part.text: Compounds containing boron and nitrogen, phosphorus, sulfur, selenium or tellurium

CPC-specific-text.text: Compounds containing boron and nitrogen, e.g. borazoles

reference.text: ammonium tetrafluoborates C01B35/063; ammonium borates C01B35/12

title-part.text: Compounds characterised primarily by their physical or chemical properties, rather than by their chemical constitution
Compounds having molecular sieve properties but not having base-exchange properties

note.note-paragraph: Compounds classified in main group C01B37/00 are also classified in other groups of class C01 according to their composition

CPC-specific-text.text: Metallophosphates not containing aluminium, e.g. gallophosphates or silicogallophosphates
Silicates, i.e. so-called metallosilicalites or metallozeosilites

title-part.text: Aluminophosphates containing other elements, e.g. metals, boron

CPC-specific-text.text: the other elements being metals only

title-part.text: Compounds having molecular sieve and base-exchange properties, e.g. crystalline zeolites

reference.text: treatment to modify the sorption properties, e.g. shaping using a binder, B01J20/10; treatment to modify the catalytic properties, e.g. combination of treatments to make the zeolites appropriate to their use as a catalyst, B01J29/04; treatment to improve the ion-exchange properties B01J39/14; regeneration or reactivation of ion-exchange properties B01J49/00; preparation of stabilised suspensions used in detergents C11D3/12

note.note-paragraph: In this group, the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "zeolites" means:crystalline aluminosilicates with base-exchange and molecular sieve properties, having three dimensional, microporous lattice framework structure of tetrahedral oxide units;compounds isomorphous to those of the former category, wherein the aluminium or silicon atoms in the framework are partly or wholly replaced by atoms of other elements, e.g. by gallium, germanium, phosphorus or boron.
Compounds classified in main group C01B39/00 are also classified in other groups of class C01 according to their composition

title-part.text: Preparation thereof starting from a reaction mixture containing a crystalline zeolite of another type, or from preformed reactants

CPC-specific-text.text: Preparation of physical mixtures or intergrowth products of zeolites chosen from group C01B39/04 or two or more of groups C01B39/14 - C01B39/48

title-part.text: using at least one organic template directing agent, e.g. an ionic quaternary ammonium compound or an aminated compound
Preparation of isomorphous zeolites characterised by measures to replace the aluminium or silicon atoms in the lattice framework by atoms of other elements

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. by direct or secondary synthesis

title-part.text: the aluminium atoms being wholly replaced

CPC-specific-text.text: using at least one organic template directing agent

title-part.text: from aqueous solutions of an alkali metal aluminate and an alkali metal silicate excluding any other source of alumina or silica but seeds
from a reaction mixture containing at least one aluminium silicate or aluminosilicate of a clay type, e.g. kaolin or metakaolin or its exotherm modification or allophane
Faujasite type, e.g. type X or Y

CPC-specific-text.text: using at least one organic template directing agent; Hexagonal faujasite; Intergrowth products of cubic and hexagonal faujasite
using at least one organic template directing agent

title-part.text: Erionite or offretite type, e.g. zeolite T

CPC-specific-text.text: using at least one organic template directing agent

title-part.text: Pentasil type, e.g. types ZSM-5, ZSM-8 or ZSM-11

CPC-specific-text.text: Type ZSM-8; Type ZSM-11; ZSM 5/11 intermediate

title-part.text: using at least one organic template directing agent
Ferrierite type, e.g. types ZSM-21, ZSM-35 or ZSM-38

CPC-specific-text.text: using at least one organic template directing agent

title-part.text: Other types characterised by their X-ray diffraction pattern and their defined composition
using at least one organic template directing agent
Zeolites wherein inorganic bases or salts occlude channels in the lattice framework, e.g. sodalite, cancrinite, nosean, hauynite
Phosphates, e.g. APO or SAPO compounds

note.note-paragraph: Phosphates having either a poorly defined or a weak base-exchange capacity such as MAPO's, SAPO's or BAPO's are classified in C01B37/00

title-part.text: Preparation of ozone by electrical discharge
Dischargers used for production of ozone
Electrodes used for obtaining electrical discharge
Dielectrics used in the electrical dischargers
Part of the product being recycled
Additional processes occurring alongside the electrical discharges, e.g. catalytic processes
Structure or properties of carbon nanotubes
Nanotubes with a specific amount of walls
Integrated processes for the production of hydrogen or synthesis gas

reference.text: reactors or details thereof B01J2208/00 - B01J2219/00

title-part.text: Processes for making hydrogen or synthesis gas
containing a non-catalytic steam reforming step
containing a non-catalytic carbon dioxide reforming step
the reforming step being a steam reforming step
the reforming step being a carbon dioxide reforming step
the reforming step being an autothermal reforming step, e.g. secondary reforming processes
containing a non-catalytic partial oxidation step
containing a catalytic partial oxidation step [CPO]
containing a CO-shift step, i.e. a water gas shift step
containing three or more CO-shift steps
containing a purification step for the hydrogen or the synthesis gas
In-situ membrane purification during hydrogen production
In-situ adsorption process during hydrogen production
Regenerative adsorption process in two or more beds, one for adsorption, the other for regeneration
the impurity being an organic compound
the impurity being a sulfur compound
the reforming process taking place in the fuel cell
Methods of heating the process for making hydrogen or synthesis gas
at least part of the fuel being a recycle stream
Heating by indirect heat exchange with hot fluids, other than combustion gases, product gases or non-combustive exothermic reaction product gases
by heat exchange with exothermic reactions, other than by combustion of fuel
the non-combustive exothermic reaction being another reforming reaction as defined in groups C01B2203/02 - C01B2203/0294
by combination of different heating methods
Catalysts for performing the hydrogen forming reactions
Packed bed of catalytic structures, e.g. particles, packing elements
characterised by the form of the structure
Catalysts in the form of a monolith or honeycomb
Catalysts in the form of a foam
Catalyst coated on equipment surfaces, e.g. reactor walls
Feeding the process for making hydrogen or synthesis gas
Organic compounds or organic mixtures used in the process for making hydrogen or synthesis gas
Evaporation of one or more of the different feed components
Evaporation by heat exchange with hot process stream
At least two reforming, decomposition or partial oxidation steps in parallel
At least two reforming, decomposition or partial oxidation steps in series
Three or more reforming, decomposition or partial oxidation steps in series
At least two purification steps in parallel
At least two purification steps in series
Three or more purification steps in series
involving a recycle stream to the feed of the process for making hydrogen or synthesis gas
Controlling the amount of the product
Controlling the composition of the product
Measuring the composition of the product
Adjusting the composition of the product
Control based on demand of downstream process
Adjusting the feed of the combustion
Aspect of integrated processes for the production of hydrogen or synthesis gas not covered by groups C01B2203/02 - C01B2203/1695
Several process steps of C01B2203/02 - C01B2203/08 integrated into a single apparatus
Specific amount of layers or specific thickness
characterized by their width or by their aspect ratio
Purification or separation of specific gases
Separation of the specific gas from gas mixtures containing a minor amount of this specific gas
Separation of a mixture of noble gases
